newsitem.title: JAPAN: Softbank to invest in US software venture.
newsitem.headline: Softbank to invest in US software venture.

text.p: Softbank Corp said on Monday that it would invest in California computer software venture Trend Micro.
Details of the investment will be announced at around 4.30 p.m. (0730 GMT), Softbank said.
Local newspaper Nihon Keizai Shimbun reported over the weekend that Softbank would acquire 30 percent of the outstanding stock of the U.S. firm for about four billion yen.
The company, which develops software to protect against computer viruses, plans to list its shares on Japan's over-the-counter market after moving its headquarters to Japan, the paper said.
Among the firms it supplies software to under OEM contracts are Fujitsu Ltd and Intel Corp, the paper said.
Its sales in Japan are expected to total two billion yen in the year to end-December 1996, the paper said.
